1.text: An aged person thou mayest not rebuke, but be entreating as a father; younger persons as brethren;

2.text: aged women as mothers, younger ones as sisters—in all purity;

3.text: honour widows who are really widows;

4.text: and if any widow have children or grandchildren, let them learn first to their own house to show piety, and to give back a recompense to the parents, for this is right and acceptable before God.

5.text: And she who is really a widow and desolate, hath hoped upon God, and doth remain in the supplications and in the prayers night and day,

6.text: and she who is given to luxury, living—hath died;

7.text: and these things charge, that they may be blameless;

8.text: and if any one for his own—and especially for those of the household—doth not provide, the faith he hath denied, and than an unbeliever he is worse.

9.text: A widow—let her not be enrolled under sixty years of age, having been a wife of one husband,

10.text: in good works being testified to: if she brought up children, if she entertained strangers, if saints’ feet she washed, if those in tribulation she relieved, if every good work she followed after;

11.text: and younger widows be refusing, for when they may revel against the Christ, they wish to marry,

12.text: having judgment, because the first faith they did cast away,

13.text: and at the same time also, they learn to be idle, going about the houses; and not only idle, but also tattlers and busybodies, speaking the things they ought not;

14.text: I wish, therefore, younger ones to marry, to bear children, to be mistress of the house, to give no occasion to the opposer to reviling;

15.text: for already certain did turn aside after the Adversary.

16.text: If any believing man or believing woman have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the assembly be burdened, that those really widows it may relieve.

17.text: The well-leading elders of double honour let them be counted worthy, especially those labouring in word and teaching,

18.text: for the Writing saith, ‘An ox treading out thou shalt not muzzle,’ and ‘Worthy is the workman of his reward.’

19.text: Against an elder an accusation receive not, except upon two or three witnesses.

20.text: Those sinning, reprove before all, that the others also may have fear;

21.text: I testify fully, before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the choice messengers, that these things thou mayest keep, without forejudging, doing nothing by partiality.

22.text: Be laying hands quickly on no one, nor be having fellowship with sins of others; be keeping thyself pure;

23.text: no longer be drinking water, but a little wine be using, because of thy stomach and of thine often infirmities;

24.text: of certain men the sins are manifest beforehand, leading before to judgment, and certain also they follow after;

25.text: in like manner also the right works are manifest beforehand, and those that are otherwise are not able to be hid.
